title: Basic Usage - Variables: incorrect variable name
body_html:
The state variable is named 'var', but it is referred as 'state' afterwards.
Changing this:
new_value = tf.add(state, one)
update = tf.assign(state, new_value)
To this:
new_value = tf.add(var, one)
update = tf.assign(var, new_value)
Solves the problem.
body_text:
The state variable is named 'var', but it is referred as 'state' afterwards.
Changing this:
new_value = tf.add(state, one)
update = tf.assign(state, new_value)
To this:
new_value = tf.add(var, one)
update = tf.assign(var, new_value)
Solves the problem.
body:
The state variable is named 'var', but it is referred as 'state' afterwards.
Changing this:
new_value = tf.add(**state**, one)
update = tf.assign(**state**, new_value)
To this:
new_value = tf.add(**var**, one)
update = tf.assign(**var**, new_value)
Solves the problem.
